R.content: since concept of democracy has always been suicidal, if there is to be a democracy to come must think life otherwise, life and the force of life [contra to Aristotle’s actuality as life?]

FL.content: for Benjamin, mythological violence of law sacrifices the living, whereas divine violence sacrifices life to save the living (destructive)
for Benjamin, what is sacred is the justice of life not mere life

LOBL.content: “What is life?” asks of its essence and its value
life being drawn through by a line, edge where it is impossible to settle: arreté
more-than-life (sur-vie) marks a reprieve, excess triumphs over life, worth more than eternity of life but presents itself before the arrêt de mort
how do we let a text live? letting someone read is like letting them live [re: Derrida pointing us toward Blanchot]

SPOM.content: je voudrais apprendre à vivre enfin (I would like to learn to live finally)
man’s life always more than a paradigm, other than a symbol > a proper name (see p. 220 on man) [one should never speak of the assassination of a man as a figure? martydom]

commitment of justice, to whom? to life (natural life, life of spirit) of living being > that this is irrefutable carries justice beyond present life, non pas vers la mort mais vers une sur-vie, where life & death are traces of traces
alors il y a de l’esprit, des esprits, et il faut compter avec eux > le plus d’un
the closure or principle of ruin (see p. 220 on ash) of a philosophy of life, since negativity must be there

A.content: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time

VM.content: Hegel’s speculative logic: living logic which reconciles formal tautology and empirical heterology [after having thought prophetic discourse in preface to Phenom…]

PP.content: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic
living-beings, father and son, are announced to us w/in household (domesticité) of logos
writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living

two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]

VP.content: phenomenology (MOP in form of ideality) is also a philosophy of life, death is an empirical and extrinsic accident, everything is light, living light, blazes open passage to reduction

metaphor, concept of life allows Husserl to assert a parallelism btwn empirical life and transcendental life, which are radically heterogenous to each other [is Husserl’s parallelism different from that of transcendental psychologism? see pp. 11-2]

strange unity of life in Husserl: 1) biological life 2) concept of psychē is life as self-relation > the pre-transcendental becomes the ultra-transcendental, Derrida says maybe concept of life calls for another name
presence to itself of animating act, this intimacy of life to itself is why we say speech is alive, we hear our voice, thus the deaf are dumb

FWT.content: think “life” on basis of heritage, not the other way around

leave life in life & make it live again, “let live,” laisser, most beautiful, hazardous thing, like giving up, giving over the gift, forgiveness > deconstruction never w/out this love, pays homage to those it takes on, s’en prendre
mustn’t crush dimensions of living being [biology, cultural] into each other, all life (animal & human) survives by knowing how to discern (btwn forms of life, btwn “living” and “dead”)

OTO.content: Nietzsche: “I live on my own credit (Ich lebe auf meinen eigenen Kredit hin)”

Nietzsche never knows if anyone will honor the inordinate credit he grants himself in his name, & in the name of the other; autobiography as secret contract (annulus), encrypted credit account: for Nietzsche, his life, the “I-live,” is perhaps mere prejudice (Vorurteil)
[Nietzsche’s] life can only be verified after or during arrêt de mort > when the bearer of the name, whom, in our prejudice, we call living, will have died
if life returns, it will return to the name, not to the living, “in the name of the living as a name of the dead”
it is life, as the living feminine, that must return eternally, selectively > life allied to herself by nuptial annulus, wedding ring
btwn title & book to come, exergue situates place from which life will be recited: yes, yes, amen, amen, I sign, I am in debt to “high noon” [instant of signature, no place]

ATIA.content: properly phenomenological logic of “I am” means there is only “I think” > breath, life are secondary: “I breathe, therefore I am” concludes nothing > indubitability of existence depends on thought (not being-in-life)
mark, gramma, trace, differance refer differentially to all living things, all relations btwn living and nonliving
metaphysics begins w/ “I am” not “I am living,” leaving an unthought “thinking of life,” the living present where Derrida began too, to deconstruct
principle of life (torat haïm) never prevented animal sacrifice in Judaism
all thinkers who demand response to be human don’t think iterability essential to every response: which adds an automatic, mechanical reaction to the most alive, authentic, responsible
Derrida affirms Lacan’s “the subject receives even the message he emits [from the Other]” as a way to inscribe reaction/response in all vicissitudes of the living

to “let” something “be” “as such,” you would have to “let be” in your absence, in your death [thus, for Heidegger, being-toward-death and “as such” constitutive of each other], but is this ever possible? can we let the being be? Nietzsche would say no, that the objective is always caught in the living, in life, in perspective > whatever the difference btwn animals, remains an “animal” relation
Derrida’s strategy re: border(s) btwn animal/human: there is no pure and simple “as such”

PS.content: TN. Blanchot does to Artaud what hegel does to Novalis (Beautiful Soul) > extract the life from the thought

(with remarkable/ambiguous exception of Hegel) God is Death: infinite life, life w/out difference > w/in life God-Death names finitude, difference w/in life > mais l'autre nom de la même chose ne veut pas dire la même chose que le premier nom, il n'en est pas synonyme et c'est toute l'histoire

O.content: Hegel: formalism as superficial analogy, empty application of formula, not inner life of self-movement (Selbstbewegung)
for Hegel, life is essential philosophical determination of concept & spirit (vegetal, biological traits), organicity of encyclopedic logic [inborn germ of death]

DPi.content: for Rousseau, the state gives you life: life is a conditional gift of the state
for my life to be safe/assured, must promise to lose it
Blanchot: literature is Terror in that its being is where “life bears death and maintains itself in death itself” [quotation from Hegel] [see RGE p. 335n]
for Hugo, inviolability of human life—an inalienable property > right of property over one’s own life no less sacred than patrimonial right of family (domicile as right of property)
for Kant, life for life’s sake is unworthy of human dignity, failure to inscribe death in law, return to animal (feminine)
disinterest as pure interest of pure reason [?] > [Kant’s disinterest raises itself above the living, sacrifices the living]
for Nietzsche, hostility to life is inherent to life
Hugo’s “inviolability of life” a principle of life that sentences death sentence to death

“my life” passes by way of the heart of the other, can only prefer living to dead, living present, where it “receives its life from the heart of the other” > “my life” depends on (tient au) the heart of the other
it belongs to life not to be immortal, but also to have a future where instant of death is not calculable

to be against DP is to be against calculation, calculable decidability of you will die on such and such a day, at such and such an hour > no future w/ anticipation of calculable instant > “my life” must keep a relation to the coming of the other as coming of the to-come (venue de l’à-venir)
DP ends finitude of “my life” > w/ calendar
Kant: man of honor values honor more highly than life, willing to accept DP, but a scoundrel considers it better to live in shame then not at all

TB.content: one can think maturation of seed as a geneticist/vitalist metaphor, this would support genealogical/parental code > or, one can invert/overturn order, “metaphorical catastrophe”: only understand “family,” “life” by way of language & its sur-vival, [this reversal is operated expressly by Benjamin?]

RGE.content: Hegel’s master/slave an economy of life [vs. economy of death]
ruse of life, ruse of reason

Gi.content: Dasein’s neutrality makes possible concrete facticity of human, the analytic precedes “the existent,” not a philosophy of life
ontology of life requires a “privative interpretation” [could one speak of a method?]; in Heidegger, life is neither pure Vorhandensein nor Dasein: what is life, then?

EJQB.content: metaphor (animality of letter): primary & infinite equivocality of signifier as life > psychic subversion of inert literality (i.e. nature) or of speech returned to nature

books are always books of life, or of afterlife > written questions addressed to literature are forgotten, drained, by literature (mortifications, ruses of life, life negating itself in literature to survive): writing would die of pure vigilance to question (and also simple erasure of question)

PSSS.content: originary affirmation is attached to a life, but an im-possible life, a sur-vival, not symbolizable, but the only one worthy of being lived, w/out alibi, the one from which to depart
one cannot justify pacifism, right to life, setting out from an economy of life, can only be done on basis of a sur-vival that owes nothing to alibi of some mytho-theological beyond

D.content: life & presence as privileged examples [of folding back onto their own limit, folding back in their very triggering] > inscribes difference in heart of life

LI.content: as if the simulation of “real life” were not part of “real life”!

TN.content: incarnation of Psyche is “posthumous”—what does this do to psych-ology (life of living)?
Aristotle’s Peri psuchēs (de Anima) is treatise on the pure life of the living
living moment of life an interiorization or expulsion? becoming-tangible of untouchable or an idealization?

EW.content: do we have a responsibility to the living? “no” > because the question is asked through canonized or hegemonic discourse of Western Metaphysics (even Heidegger & Levinas)

BSi.content: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify
animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State

acc. Hobbes, fear exceeds corporeal presence, thus it is the passion/origin of law, the origin of crime too [terror] > no contrary to fear [like Nietzsche’s, Freud’s cruelty]: coextensive w/ all political passion; fear is primarily fear for one’s own proper body, fear is passion of life

nonknowledge of bête, spirit of seminar; the living in life itself outplays opposition btwn bêtise and its supposed contrary > Nietzsche one of most eloquent witnesses of this theme: both man & animal, both idiotic & cunning—no decidable limit

pitiless lucidity of cogito, triumph of conscious self-positing self, the thesis of self always reflects itself as bêtise, bêtise always triumphs > Triumph of Life in bêtise ——bêtise always on side of victor > bêtise must not find itself bête: that would be suicidal
Heidegger’s problem w/ zōon logon ekhon, it’s “zoological,” late-on-the-scene, does not question the essence of life
for Heidegger, Den Eigensinnigen ist Leben nur Leben, for the stubborn, for those with one thing in mind, life is only, merely, life > stubborn bêtise that doesn’t ask any questions
for John, there must be an ontological affinity btwn life, zōē, and logos [in the beginning was the word] > zoo-logy, a life in logos, a zōē

OG.content: privilege of phonè necessary moment of economy (of “life,” of “history,” of “être comme rapport à soi”), not historical contingency: not a choice that could have been avoided

effacement of signifier in voice is the condition of the idea of truth: ce leurre est l’histoire de la vérité, & the constituent closure: the word is lived (vécu) as elementary, indecomposable > transparent experience/expression of “être,” of word “être”
transcendental reduction—refers to lebendige Gegenwart (The Living Present), reduces trace > commanded by theme of presence
logos as sublimation of trace is theological from Plato to infinitist metaphysics: logocentrism…parousia, life w/out differance (name of God as name of indifference)

auto-affection, universal structure of experience, being capable of being affected by other, capable of symbolizing, another name for “life,” the as-for-itself or for-itself: subjectivity—gains in its mastery of the other to the extent that its power of repetition idealizes itself (s’idéalise) > the external, the signifier, becomes my spontaneity, and escapes me less and less
masturbation & writing totally indistinguishable inasmuch as each puts into play (met en jeu) the presence of the present, the life of the living

FV.content: [vis-à-vis Lacan] present speech, anamnesis, irreplaceable properness, inalienable singularity > disqualification of recording or repetition in the name of the act of living (present speech): a well known program
